sources.data_found: The GPU resources on Hopper currently include 31 GPU nodes each equipped with four A100 80GB GPUs and 1 node with four H100 80GB GPUs. Additionally, Hopper has 2 DGX GPU nodes, each with 8 A100.40GB GPUs. Currently, eight of the GPU nodes in the gpuq partition are subdivided into MIG GPU slices.
The new GPU nodes all have 4 NVIDIA A100 80GB GPUs and 64 CPU cores with 512GB of RAM.
ARGO: Additionally there are 4 nodes each with 4x NVIDIA 32GB V100, two nodes support NVLink. There are also four nodes with NVIDIA K80 GPUs totaling 20 K80 GPU devices.

Our department has also seen a huge increase in enrollments, growing from 550 undergraduate students in 2012 to over 2,200 today. We have nearly 200 PhD students, and over 950 Masters students enrolled in four MS programs.

student_data.notes: CS department enrollment figures explicitly stated in departmental blog post. The blog post states: 'Our department has also seen a huge increase in enrollments, growing from 550 undergraduate students in 2012 to over 2,200 today. We have nearly 200 PhD students, and over 950 Masters students enrolled in four MS programs.'

other_high_vram_gpus.notes: 2x login nodes, each with 1x NVIDIA T4 GPU cards
ARGO cluster: four nodes with NVIDIA K80 GPUs totaling 20 K80 GPU devices

gpu_resources.notes:
CLUSTERS INCLUDED + CALCULATIONS

1) Hopper Cluster:
   - 31 GPU nodes × 4 A100 80GB/node = 124 A100 80GB GPUs
   - 1 node × 4 H100 80GB = 4 H100 GPUs
   - 2 DGX nodes × 8 A100 40GB/node = 16 A100 40GB GPUs
   Total Hopper GPUs = 124 A100 80GB + 4 H100 + 16 A100 40GB = 144 GPUs

2) ARGO Cluster:
   - 4 nodes × 4 V100 32GB/node = 16 V100 GPUs
   - 4 nodes with K80 GPUs totaling 20 K80 GPU devices
   Total ARGO GPUs = 16 V100 + 20 K80 = 36 GPUs

3) Additional GPUs:
   - 2 login nodes × 1 T4 GPU/node = 2 T4 GPUs (Hopper login nodes)

FINAL TOTALS (ALL CLUSTERS):
- H100 80GB = 4
- A100 80GB = 124
- A100 40GB = 16
- V100 32GB = 16
- K80 = 20 (listed in other_high_vram_gpus)
- T4 = 2 (listed in other_high_vram_gpus)

Note: Eight of the GPU nodes in Hopper are configured with MIG (Multi-Instance GPU) slices: 32 MIG 3g.40gb partitions, 32 MIG 2g.20gb partitions, and 64 MIG 1g.10gb partitions.

analysis_notes: George Mason University operates two main HPC clusters: Hopper (primary) and ARGO (legacy). The CS department has experienced significant growth, with undergraduate enrollment quadrupling from 550 in 2012 to over 2,200 students. The university has been investing in GPU infrastructure, including recent additions of A100 80GB nodes and one H100 node. The H100 node represents George Mason's entry into the latest generation of NVIDIA GPUs. A significant portion of the A100 GPUs are configured with MIG technology to maximize utilization for diverse workloads.
